word: I have been shown that a few words spoken in a hasty manner, under provocation, and which seemed but a little thing--just what they deserved, often cut the cords of influence that should have bound the soul to your soul.  The very idea of their being in darkness, under the temptation of Satan and blinded by his bewitching power, should make you feel deep sympathy for them--the same that you would feel for a diseased patient who suffers, but, on account of his disease, is not aware of his danger.--Letter 20, 1892 (Oct. 17, 1892 to J. H. Kellogg).
